resources.string:
\tWelcome to my ResumeApp! Take a peak at some of my previous work, and try to keep an eye on the app\'s behaviour. I tried my best to implement as many UI/UX tricks I\'ve learned throughout the months (with moderation of course.)
\n\n\tIf you like what you see, you\'ll find all my credentials at the Contact Page!

I am a student at the University of Toronto who will be graduating this June with a major in Human Biology, a major in Pharmacology & a minor in Computer Science.


	I started to transition from the Life Sciences to Software Engineering when I was challenged to build a calculator on Minecraft for Xbox. This was an understandably arduous task considering I did not know any binary code, logic gating, or even of the Coding Block that existed on the PC version of the game!


	To keep a long story short, I made a very rough first draft that could only calculate 1+2, 1+3 or 2+3. After improving upon my design by building an extendable "skeleton" that could sum any distinct positive integer, I decided to take "Computer Science for the Life Sciences" (CSC120) & the rest is history!
See below for a brief overview of my published work. Feel free to take a glance at my other miscellaneous work as well at:
University of Toronto, St. George Campus | Toronto, ON
B2B Bank Head Office | Toronto, ON

Responsible for developing an ongoing prototype Android application for the start-up.


Rebuilt the Android application from the ground up, improving the UX & UI by improving the clarity & hierarchy of activities & redefining the theme & structure of activities.


Took the initiative to redesign the company website, increasing website responsivity & improving UI by using Bootstrap.

An exploratory project to emulate the Linux bash terminal on a web browser. Progress was to be guided & supervised by two professors, however the work was done independently.


Starting from nothing, I managed to quickly browse & eliminate different options, narrowing down to the most appropriate implementation.


As a prototype is required, I have taken the initiative to learn JavaScript & the Node.js Express framework.


This project largely written in JavaScript & C, using emscripten to convert the C code to WebAssembly code.

Responsible for helping complete the bank’s many time-sensitive administrative duties, while assessing the quality of the team’s work & any documents coming in & out of the bank.


On many occasions, I have coordinated my peers & directed them onto different queues to prevent backlog.


I have improved productivity by revising team-specific work procedures & training documents & improved client response rates by revising translations on bank correspondence.


I have taken the initiative to seek training on various work types to help support a high-turnover work environment.
